Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I am currently searching for an experience Data Scientist to join a valued client of mine within in the financial sector based in Brussels.




In this role, you will leverage your data science expertise to analyze complex datasets, build predictive models, and uncover insights that drive data-informed decision-making. This freelance opportunity is ideal for a data scientist who values flexibility, thrives on solving real-world problems, and has a passion for innovative analysis.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Build, train, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to address specific business challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and provide data-driven recommendations.
Design and implement experiments to test hypotheses and optimize business processes.
Present findings and communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with advancements in data science and machine learning techniques to continuously improve analyses.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist (freelance experience preferred).
Proficiency in data science and machine learning tools, such as Python, R, and SQL.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Strong skills in statistical analysis, data modeling, and predictive analytics.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and ability to convey complex findings clearly.
Excellent problem-solving skills with strong analytical and critical thinking abilities.




Fluent in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexible working arrangements, with remote work options.
Opportunity to work on diverse, impactful projects.
A collaborative environment with a team dedicated to data-driven innovation

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About our role

Our client is a renowned name in the Belgian banking industry, seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join their innovative team. In this role, you will drive advancements in machine learning pipelines, ensuring solutions are production-ready by design. Your work will bridge AI and IT production teams to deploy and monitor impactful ML models within the organisation.




You will have the opportunity to make a significant contribution to the AI-driven transformation in the banking sector, working with a dynamic and diverse team. If you are passionate about machine learning and innovation, this role is for you!




What you will be doing




Collaborating with Data Scientists to design and develop target solutions while considering production constraints, including data ingestion schemes and API synchronicity.
Automating ML pipeline components to integrate and deploy them into production, such as building Docker/VM images and creating test environments.
Supporting Data Scientists in leveraging existing industrial tools to build and monitor AI services, including CI/CD platforms.
Working with IT Production teams to parameterise and optimise target environments for seamless operation.
Ensuring models run error-free, retraining them as necessary, and monitoring performance from both IT and business perspectives.

What you bring

Ambition to further develop your career in machine learning engineering.
At least 3 years of solid experience in similar roles.
Expertise in containerisation/virtualisation, AI platforms, CI/CD (GitLab-CI), and data versioning tools.
Proficiency in Python and dependency management tools.
Experience with PostgreSQL and data visualisation tools.
Familiarity with big data tools like Spark, ETL/ELT pipelines, and model compression techniques is a plus.
Strong communication, problem-solving, and innovation-driven mindset.
Language proficiency: English is mandatory; Dutch and French are a plus.

The offer

Contractor collaboration for 12 months, with possible extensions.
Hybrid working model: 50% on-site, 50% remote.
Work for a leading banking institution and make a tangible impact in its digital transformation journey.
Be part of a skilled and diverse team focused on delivering exceptional user experiences.

You’re joining an impressive network of 100+ digital consultants, all dedicated to driving innovation and supporting each other.
We match you with projects that suit your skills and ambitions.
Personalised follow-up and guidance from our Digital Talent Managers.
Opportunities for professional development through our rich community events and meetups.

Access to top-tier European brands like Samsung, ING Bank, Carrefour, and many more.

Title: Clinical Data Scientist
Description:
Heads, a global CRO, is seeking a Clinical Data Scientist based in Europe to join its growing global interventional hematology/oncology clinical program in its global Data Management and Statistics department (DMS).




The Clinical Data Scientist is responsible to propose implement and support activities and procedures, as well as, to design and develop automatic processes and statistical tools supporting a clinical study's efficiency monitoring and regulatory compliance.




The Clinical Data Scientist designs and develops SAS codes, macros and templates covering data management and exploration aspects, statistical analysis and interpretation /assessment of results, reporting and monitoring requirements (data and/or reports) on study's evolution, arising from the clinical study's protocol, the statistical plan and the data management plan, as well as, Company processes, regulatory requirements/standards and Sponsors requirements.




This is a full-time position




Main responsibilities:

-Designs and develops statistical tools and processes in SAS to

build SAS datasets from clinical database and other sources (if applicable)
build queries/macros to support data quality issues and data cleaning purposes
generate tables, listings, figures for analysis requirements
implement statistical analysis as specified in the protocol, the Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and the Data Management Plan (DMP)
generate statistical management reports for monitoring the study’s evolution
generate reporting requirements (data and reports) upon study/customer requests
support reporting requirements (data and reports) arising from regulatory agencies
support data transfer requirements for ongoing trials.




-Maintains SAS programs/processes depository and documentation

-Reviews eCRF annotations and data specifications

-Participates in the design of the clinical database for assigned clinical studies

-Prepares the statistical analysis, as well as clinical, statistical summary reports or/and customer reports

-Performs data transfer and reporting requirements for assigned studies

-Validates the programmed analysis datasets, macros, queries and analysis results (listings, tables, figures) prepared by other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department

-Provides support to other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department both in the use of Company’s statistical tools and processes

-Assists other members of the Data Management and Statistics Department in developing SAS programs/macros for generating tables, listings, figures and analysis datasets

-Provides support on processes to other Departments’ staff or external partners for the assigned studies and/or to Sponsors

-Reviews and updates departmental SOPs

-Oversees systems UAT

-Approves and conducts departmental trainings




Required qualifications:

− BSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Data Analysis, Data Science, or

related field

− MSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Data Analysis, Data Science, or

related field

-At least 5 years of experience in a SAS environment preferably in clinical

studies in a CRO, pharma or equivalent institution

− Excellent command of spoken and written English

-Experience in the design and development of statistical tools for automatic/monitoring

processes

− Experience in reporting platforms and procedures/ standards for regulatory purposes

− Proficient in statistical computing or statistical programming language

− Expertise in data management, statistical analysis processes and reporting in SAS

software

− Excellent analytical skills

− Ability to identify data quality issues, present problems, design and implement solutions

− Capability of communicating technical concepts clearly, concisely, and understandably to non-statistical colleagues

− Strong communication skills

− Ability to work in a collaborative environment

− Strong organizational, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

− Organizational and time management skills with the ability to multi-task




Join us to be part of a multidisciplinary team of highly skilled scientists and healthcare professionals in the forefront of Clinical Research within a friendly work environment.

Competitive remuneration package comes on top.




In Heads we consider Data Protection an integral part of our operational business principles and are committed to respecting your privacy. For information on how we process your personal data please visit our Privacy Notice to Candidates: https://heads-research.com/canditates-privacy-notice/

We're on the lookout for a skilled Growth Data Scientist to join our team, where you'll be pivotal in driving business growth and maximising ROI. This is your chance to make a significant impact on our market-leading products, optimising growth initiatives and delivering actionable insights. Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.

Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:


You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals


Main Qualifications


Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing


Top reasons to work with us:


Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
About Smartcat

Smartcat is on a mission to become the wall-to-wall Language AI platform, addressing the diverse needs in multilingual content for various user personas within global enterprises.

Smartcat is uniquely positioned within the $100+ billion multilingual content industry, which is currently served by tens of thousands of agencies. This results in a highly fragmented and inefficient supply chain, high costs, unacceptable turnaround times, and quality issues. Using highly qualified internal resources to translate or create multilingual content (insourcing) solves the quality problem for enterprises, but if done manually, it can't solve for scalability, high cost, and slow turnaround.

Smartcat changes the ROI equation in favor of insourcing with its Language AI platform for enterprise end-users. It delivers high-quality, instantaneous AI translations or generates new content in any language by tapping into a customer-specific multilingual content library. The AI output is further refined through human editing by the client's internal reviewers or experts from the Smartcat's embedded global marketplace of linguists and content editors. This AI output continuously improves through the editing feedback loop, ensuring consistent and customer-tailored results.

More than 1,000 global companies including ~20% of the Fortune 1,000 trust Smartcat to communicate their innovations and ideas all over the world.

As a dynamic Series C company, Smartcat is growing at 130% YoY, thanks to the high and quick ROI it delivers to global enterprises. It's well-funded by notable VCs, and is capital efficient, offering a unique blend of hyper-growth potential with downside protection and the capacity for long-term planning and strategy.

Mission

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be at the forefront of advancing our platform’s computer vision capabilities. Leveraging your expertise in machine learning including data curation, pipeline development, and model monitoring, you will deliver high-performance solutions that power critical features for our growing client base.

The ideal candidate possesses a broad range of expertise in machine learning (data labeling, training pipeline development, and model deployment/maintenance), as well as strong engineering skills. In this role, you will tackle complex challenges across our computer vision (CV) projects and play a key part in driving innovation by contributing to our cutting-edge Image and Video Translation products.

Requirements


Expertise in Computer Vision: experience delivering end-to-end CV projects (e.g., detection, segmentation, analysis, OCR, classification, video processing).
Foundational ML Skills: familiarity with classical ML techniques (e.g., clustering, boosting).
ML Lifecycle Knowledge: deep understanding of a machine learning project lifecycle.
Python Engineering: experience developing and maintaining Python microservices and libraries.
Ownership & Decision-Making: ability to work independently within a designated scope.


Key Responsibilities


Data Management: Coordinate data labeling efforts and curate high-quality datasets.
Model Development: Design, develop, and optimize ML training pipelines.
Deployment: Prepare models for production and contribute to deployment processes.
Monitoring & Maintenance: Oversee production models, ensuring proper performance through monitoring, fine-tuning, and troubleshooting.


Our technologies


ML: Python, Pytorch, Weights & Biases, Label-Studio
Databases: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch
Messaging Queue: Apache Kafka
Cloud Provider: Amazon AWS

Experience as a software architect or in a software engineer role

Solid understanding of relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and SQL

Excellent communication skills, allowing you to successfully convey technical concepts as well as architectural decisions to both technical peers as well as functional profiles (product owners/managers, customer success, etc.)

Due to our rapid growth, we are always looking for ambitious and enthusiastic new talents.

Description:
We are looking for..

a data scientist with a strong knowledge in machine and deep learning to strengthen the activities of our innovation team and Earth Observation activities. GIM uses an open innovation approach to respond flexibly to our rapidly changing ecosystem and to continuously renew our products and services portfolio.

As experienced data science professional

I am the driving force behind our Earth Observation AI developments that are used for the further extension of our Belmap product and on customer projects. I provide technical input for research proposals centered around AI for GEO and Earth Observation, and implement the resulting innovation projects.




I contribute to our excellent customer experience by supporting my sales colleagues on their customer visits and contribute to the (pre)sales process by thinking along with the customer, delivering technical advice and giving demos. My fluency in Dutch (mandatory!) as well as English, is a big asset in this context. My experience with working on complex projects and my excellent communication skills ensure that we create win-win situations with our customers.




I keep up-to-date on the newest technical and scientific developments within the machine learning, Earth Observation and geotechnology domains and share my knowledge with my GIM colleagues. What do we offer you?

At GIM we are convinced that employees make the difference. We offer you a versatile function in a dynamic and highly innovative company, excellent working conditions and real possibilities for career development. Location: Remote

Program Type: Unpaid Internship with In-Depth Training

Duration: 3 Months

Learn More: https://www.refontelearning.com/




Program Overview:

Embark on a rewarding career path in data science and artificial intelligence with our immersive AI & Data Science Training and Internship Program. Over the course of the program, you’ll learn key data science techniques, AI algorithms, and machine learning models that are transforming industries. This internship will prepare you to solve real-world problems by analyzing large datasets and implementing data-driven AI solutions.

Learn Data Science & AI Fundamentals: Master the basics of data analysis, machine learning, and AI, and how these are applied to real-world problems.
Deep Dive into Machine Learning: Understand the principles of supervised and unsupervised learning, as well as advanced concepts like deep learning and neural networks.
Hands-On AI Projects: Apply your knowledge to real-life data science projects, from data collection and cleaning to model building and deployment.

Data Visualization & Communication: Develop your ability to present complex data findings and insights through compelling visualizations and clear communication.

Expertise in Python, R, and SQL for data analysis, manipulation, and building machine learning models.
Practical experience with machine learning frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and Keras for model building and deployment.
Knowledge of AI algorithms including decision trees, random forests, support vector machines (SVM), and neural networks.
Strong skills in data visualization, using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tableau, and Power BI to present data insights.
Experience with model deployment on cloud platforms like AWS or Google Cloud.
Understanding of big data technologies and techniques for handling large-scale datasets.




Who Should Apply:

Aspiring data scientists, AI enthusiasts, and students interested in a career in data science or artificial intelligence.
Professionals with backgrounds in mathematics, engineering, IT, or statistics, looking to upskill in the AI and data science field.
Anyone eager to work with cutting-edge AI tools, machine learning algorithms, and data analysis techniques to solve business challenges.

Real-World Experience: Work on impactful data science and AI projects that directly contribute to solving complex industry problems.
